org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report

Class PGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.ReportItem
      • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.PGroup
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Report

    public class PGroup
extends ReportItem

    Groups ReportItems together into a single ReportItem, and acts as a central component of reporting, especially as concerns relative positioning. The top/left position of a ReportItem is combined with that of its containing PGroup to obtain the absolute position of the item on the page. As ReportItems are added, PGroup recalculates its own width and height to accommodate the position & width/height of all the items it contains. Since PGroup extends ReportItem, PGroup instances can be added to other PGroups.

    Note that PGroup only adjusts its height/width and/or the position of a ReportItem when the ReportItem is added; if a ReportItem's left/top/height/width properties change after being added, the PGroup will be "unaware" of those changes, and the results may be undesirable.

    Also, since PGroup is itself a ReportItem, instances can be nested within one another.

    Adding the same ReportItem to multiple PGroups:

    When ReportItems are added to a PGroup, the top/left values of those ReportItems are altered as documented for methods like PGroup.addVertical() and PGroup.addHorizontal(). One can add the same ReportItem to different PGroups, but this will usually cause undesirable results unless the item is always the first item to be added to each of those PGroups. There is a simple workaround, however, which is to wrap the item in a "dummy" PGroup first: 

        function addAllOver(ReportItem usedALot, PGroup here, PGroup there, PGroup elsewhere) {
      here.addVertical(new PGroup(usedALot));
      there.addHorizontal(new PGroup(usedALot));
      elsewhere.add(PGroup.HRight, PGroup.VTop, new PGroup(usedALot));
    }

    In the example above, the top/left position of the wrappers are altered by each of the addXXX() variations, but the position of usedALot is left alone. It will still appear at different positions, but its position relative to the enclosing dummy groups is always the same.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PGroup

        public PGroup()

      • PGroup

        public PGroup(ReportItem... reportItems)
        Creates a new PGroup and adds reportItems to it. Assumes that reportItems.length can be used to calculate the size of PGroup's internal List (in this case, an ArrayList), so this constructor is best suited to situations where the PGroup will have a fixed size; more items can be added, but that will force resizing of the internal List and thus a slight performance hit.

      • PGroup

        public PGroup(int hv,
              ReportItem... reportItems)

        Works the same as new(ReportItem...), but adds the ReportItems vertically or horizontally according to the value of hv.

        Parameters:
        hv - Indicates whether reportItems should be added using addVertical() or addHorizontal(); use PGroup.Vertical to indicate the former, PGroup.Horizontal to indicate the latter.
        See Also:
        PGroup(ReportItem...)

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public PGroup add(ReportItem item)
        Adds item to this PGroup. Does not change the top/left position setting of item, so its actual position will be offset from the top left of this PGroup as per item.getLeft() and item.getTop()

      • add

        public PGroup add(ReportItem... items)
        A shortcut for adding multiple ReportItems; invokes add(ReportItem) for each member of items.

      • addVertical

        public PGroup addVertical(ReportItem item)
        Works the same as add(ReportItem), but positions item vertically relative to the most recently added ReportItem. If this PGroup is empty, item's position setting will be left alone; otherwise, it will be positioned beneath the last added item, i.e. item.addTop(lastAdded.getBottom()). Note that this means item will be additionally offset from the last-added ReportItem by the original value of item.getTop().

      • addVertical

        public PGroup addVertical(ReportItem... items)
        A shortcut to add multiple ReportItems using addVertical(ReportItem) .

      • addHorizontal

        public PGroup addHorizontal(ReportItem item)
        Works the same as add(ReportItem), but positions item horizontally relative to the most recently added ReportItem. If this PGroup is empty, item's position setting will be left alone; otherwise, it will be placed to the right of the last added item, i.e. item.addLeft(lastAdded.getRight());. Note that this means item will be additionally offset from the last-added ReportItem by item.getLeft().

      • addHorizontal

        public PGroup addHorizontal(ReportItem... items)
        A shortcut to add multiple ReportItems using addHorizontal(ReportItem).

      • addVerticalRight

        public PGroup addVerticalRight(ReportItem... items)
        Works the same as addVertical(items), but additionally right-justifies each item to the right side of this PGroup using item.setLeft().

      • addVerticalCenter

        public PGroup addVerticalCenter(ReportItem... items)
        Works the same as addVertical(items), but also horizontally centers each item within this PGroup using item.setLeft().

      • add

        public PGroup add(int horizontalPos,
                  int verticalPos,
                  ReportItem item)
        Adds item to this PGroup and invokes item.addLeft() and item.addTop() to change its relative position according to rules selected by horizontalPos and verticalPos.
        Parameters:
        horizontalPos - Legal values are PGroup.HLeft, PGroup.HRight, and PGroup.HCenter:
        • HLeft does nothing;
        • HCenter pushes item to the right far enough to center it within this PGroup, plus the current value of item.getLeft();
        • HRight pushes item to the right far enough to right-justify it, plus item.getLeft().
        verticalPos - Legal values are PGroup.VTop, PGroup.VCenter, and PGroup.VBottom:
        • VTop does nothing;
        • VCenter moves item down far enough to vertically center it, plus item.getTop();
        • VCenter moves item down far enough to bottom-justify it, plus item.getTop();

      • print

        public void print(SimplePDF pdf)
           throws java.lang.Exception

        Prints all of the items in this PGroup using ReportItem.print(), in the order they were added to this PGroup.

        Item positioning:

        Before a ReportItem is printed, pdf's position is moved to the relative offset determined by PGroup.getTop() and PGroup.getLeft(), plus the offset of the ReportItem as per ReportItem.getLeft() and ReportItem.getTop().

        When print() completes, pdf's position is reset to the same coordinates it had when print() was invoked.

        Specified by:
        print in class ReportItem
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        print(SimplePDF)
